Name: Funerary cone
Description: The stamp end only of an inscribed funerary cone, two separate stamps of two vertical columns of text within oval frames. There are blade or saw marks visible where the cone end was removed. Only one side of the text is still legible.Such cones were placed at the entrance to the tomb, probably pushed into the wet plaster of the lintel. The broad inscribed end of the cone was then visible to all who passed by.
